question_title: What will be the closing value of the S&P 500 on March 13, 2026?
summary: The S&P 500 closed at 6,939.03 on January 30, 2026, after a positive January (+1.4%). With 42 days until resolution on March 13, 2026, I expect modest upward drift in line with historical averages, centered around 7,010. Key positive factors include the January Barometer signal and strong earnings beat rates. Key risks include elevated valuations (equity risk premium near zero), AI/tech bubble concerns, and Fed Chair transition uncertainty. Monte Carlo mixture model with 18% volatility and scenario weighting (70% base, 18% bullish, 12% correction) produces these percentile estimates.

factors.description: Positive January Barometer (+1.4% gain) - historically predicts positive year 89% of time with avg 17% return
Strong Q4 earnings season - 78% of S&P 500 companies beating expectations
Fed Chair transition (Powell to Warsh) - market reacted calmly to nomination
AI/tech valuation concerns - Manifold prices 26.6% AI bubble burst in 2026
General market crash risk - Manifold prices 33.6% crash probability for 2026
Elevated valuations - equity risk premium near zero, historically low
Short timeframe (42 days) - limited time for major moves either direction
